io.github.robolib.framework

Class ModeSwitcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.robolib.framework.ModeSwitcher

  • public class ModeSwitcher
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles the Switching of the Game mode and the Execution of the mode. This controls what CounterMode the robot should run. It handles feeding the Watchdog and running the Scheduler.
    Author:
    noriah Reuland

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ModeSwitcher getInstance()
        Returns the ModeSwitcher, creating it if one does not exists.
        Returns:
        the ModeSwitcher

      • debug

        private void debug(java.lang.String msg)
        Debug.
        Parameters:
        msg - the msg

      • set

        protected void set(GameMode gMode,
                   RobotMode rMode)
        Add the a RobotMode to the ModeSwitcher this will overwrite any previous mode that has the same GameMode.
        Parameters:
        gMode - the GameMode that this RobotMode will be run at
        rMode - the RobotMode to add
        See Also:
        GameMode, RobotMode

      • init

        protected void init()
        Initializes the Game CounterMode Switcher. This method must be called when ready to start the robot. Checks each CounterMode to see if there is code to run, if not, a Default class will be added.
        See Also:
        DisabledMode, TestMode, AutonMode, TeleopMode

      • run

        protected void run()
        Runs the Current RobotMode. Catches any Throwable objects that may be thrown. Any caught Throwable Object is treated as fatal and will kill the RoboLibBot. They are treated as fatal because any uncaught Throwables can only be RuntimeExceptions or Errors, which are Fatal

      • getGameMode

        public GameMode getGameMode()
        Gets the current GameMode.
        Returns:
        the current GameMode

      • getRobotMode

        public RobotMode getRobotMode()
        Gets the current RobotMode. If there is no current CounterMode, then something went wrong, and an error mode is returned that will cause the robot to quit.
        Returns:
        the current RobotMode

      • getRobotMode

        public RobotMode getRobotMode(GameMode mode)
        Get the RobotMode for the given GameMode.
        Parameters:
        mode - the mode
        Returns:
        RobotMode

      • hasMode

        public boolean hasMode(GameMode mode)
        Do we have a RobotMode for this GameMode.
        Parameters:
        mode - the mode
        Returns:
        boolean - do we have it?

      • switchMode

        public void switchMode(int mode)
        Switch the current GameMode. This will first call the end() Method of the current RobotMode, then set the current GameMode, call the System Garbae Collector, and then call the new RobotMode init() method.
        Parameters:
        mode - the GameMode number to switch to.

      • switchMode

        public void switchMode(GameMode mode)
        Switch the current GameMode. This will first call the end() Method of the current RobotMode, then set the current GameMode, call the System Garbace Collector, and then call the new RobotMode init() method. Catches any Throwable objects that may be thrown. Any caught Throwable Object is treated as fatal and will kill the RoboLibBot. They are treated as fatal because any uncaught Throwables can only be RuntimeExceptions or Errors, which are Fatal
        Parameters:
        mode - the GameMode to switch to.

      • inNewMode

        public boolean inNewMode(int mode)
        Gets whether the mode given is different to the current running mode.
        Parameters:
        mode - the mode number of the comparing GameMode
        Returns:
        a boolean value, true if we are in a new mode or false if we are in the same mode

      • inNewMode

        public boolean inNewMode(GameMode mode)
        Gets whether the mode given is different to the current running mode.
        Parameters:
        mode - the GameMode we are comparing
        Returns:
        a boolean value, true if we are in a new mode or false if we are in the same mode
